post.description: Create a new Dataset. Use UploadDatasetFile to upload files to the dataset.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
dataset = client.datasets.create()
print(dataset.dataset)

post.description:
Initiate a file upload to a Dataset. Call FinalizeSingleDatasetFileUpload
 to complete the upload with the presigned URL returned from this call.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.datasets.upload_file(
    dataset_id="datasetId",
)
print(response.s3_presigned_post)

post.description:
Finalize a Dataset file upload. This call should be made after the file has
 been uploaded to the S3 URL returned from UploadDatasetFile.
Get a Dataset.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
dataset = client.datasets.get(
    id="id",
)
print(dataset.dataset)

post.description: Get a download url for a Dataset.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.datasets.get_download_url(
    dataset_id="datasetId",
)
print(response.download_url)

post.description: Get a paginated view of the data within a Dataset.
List Datasets.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
dataset = client.datasets.list()
print(dataset.datasets)

post.description: Clone a dataset into a new dataset containing the latest file contents
Archive a dataset

Evaluate a metric on rows of data, returning scores for each row. Specify
 metric.id or metric.name to identify the metric.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.evaluation.evaluate(
    ground_truth=["string"],
    input=["string"],
    metric={},
    output=["string"],
)
print(response.metric)

post.description:
Evaluate a metric on a dataset, returning scores for each example. Specify
 metric.id or metric.name to identify the metric.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.evaluation.evaluate_dataset(
    dataset_id="datasetId",
    metric={},
)
print(response.metric)

post.description: List all available evaluation metrics.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.evaluation.list_metrics()
print(response.metrics)

post.description: Get a specific evaluation metric by id or name.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.evaluation.get_metric(
    metric={},
)
print(response.metric)

post.description:
Step 1 of 2: Create a new job configuration for fine-tuning, to be
 subsequently submitted by calling SubmitFineTuneJob.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
fine_tune_job = client.fine_tune_jobs.create(
    fine_tune_job_config={
        "baseline_model_id": "baselineModelId",
        "selected_columns": ["string"],
        "test_dataset_id": "testDatasetId",
        "train_dataset_id": "trainDatasetId",
    },
)
print(fine_tune_job.job_id)

post.description:
Step 2 of 2: Submit the job configuration created by CreateFineTuneJob to
 initiate a job.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.fine_tune_jobs.submit(
    fine_tune_job_config={
        "baseline_model_id": "baselineModelId",
        "selected_columns": ["string"],
        "test_dataset_id": "testDatasetId",
        "train_dataset_id": "trainDatasetId",
    },
    job_id="jobId",
)
print(response.job_id)

post.description: Get the full job details
Get the status of an existing job, including any results.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.fine_tune_jobs.get_status(
    job_id="jobId",
)
print(response.fine_tune_job_result)

post.description: List all fine-tune jobs with optional filters.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
fine_tune_job = client.fine_tune_jobs.list()
print(fine_tune_job.jobs)

post.description: List all base models available for fine-tuning.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.fine_tune_jobs.list_base_models()
print(response.models)

post.description: Create a new Project
Get a Project.
List Projects.

Step 1 of 2: Create a new job configuration for LLM Judge labeling, to be
 subsequently submitted by calling SubmitPseudoLabelJob.

Step 2 of 2: Submit the job configuration created by CreatePseudoLabelJob
 to initiate an LLM Judge labeling job.
Get the status of an existing job, including any results.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from lastmile import Lastmile

client = Lastmile(
    bearer_token=os.environ.get("LASTMILE_API_TOKEN"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.label_dataset_jobs.get_status(
    job_id="jobId",
)
print(response.pseudo_label_job_result)

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateDatasetReq.title: CreateDatasetRequest

name.description: Human-readable name for the dataset, if one exists.

description.description: Human-readable description of the dataset, if one exists.

projectId.description: The project to add the new dataset to

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateDatasetReq.description: Create a Dataset, initially an empty shell until a file is uploaded

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Dataset.title: Dataset

name.description: Human-readable name for the dataset, if one exists.

description.description: Human-readable description of the dataset, if one exists.

ownerUserId.description: The ID of the user who owns the dataset.

items.description: The columns present in the latest DatasetFile for this dataset

labelState.description: The state of the latest labeling job for the dataset

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Dataset.description:
A Dataset in the most basic sense: metadata and ownership, but nothing tied
 to its data.

id.description: The ID of the dataset file.

index.description: Index of the column within the dataset file.

literalName.description: The literal name for the column.

dtype.title: DatasetColumnDType
dtype.description:
Datatypes for a column in a dataset file. We likely don't need everything
 here, but it's good to be explicit, for example to avoid unknowingly coercing
 int64 values into int32. Encoding for text is UTF_8 unless indicated
 otherwise.

labelingStatus.title: JobStatus
labelingStatus.description: The status of the latest general pseudo-labeling job for the dataset

error.description: if the labeling status is error, this field may contain an error message

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.UploadDatasetFil.title: UploadDatasetFileRequest

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset corresponding to the file.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.UploadDatasetFil.description: Initiate an upload by requesting a pre-signed S3 upload URL.

fields.description: Fields required for the S3 presigned POST request generated by s3 sdk.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.FinalizeSingleDa.title: FinalizeSingleDatasetFileUploadRequest

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset corresponding to the file

s3PresignedPost.description: The pre-signed S3 URL where the file was uploadeded

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.FinalizeSingleDa.description: Request to finalize a single dataset file upload

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.FinalizeSingleDa.title: FinalizeSingleDatasetFileUploadResponse

datasetFile.description: Information about the dataset file if the upload was successful

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.FinalizeSingleDa.description: Response after finalizing a single dataset file upload

id.description: The ID of the dataset file.

datasetId.description: The ID of the corresponding dataset.

downloadUrl.description: The S3 presigned URL to download the dataset file.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetDatasetViewRe.title: GetDatasetViewRequest

datasetId.description:
The ID of the dataset from which to retrieve content. When specified,
 gets data from the current file in the dataset.

datasetFileId.description:
The ID of the (pinned) dataset file from which to retrieve content.
 Requests iterating over pages of results are recommended to use this
 pinned identifier after the first page in order to prevent any effects
 from a dataset changing between the queries.

after.description: Pagination: The index, by row-order, after which to query results.

limit.description: Pagination: The maximum number of results to return on this page.

items.description: Filter criteria for the dataset rows

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetDatasetViewRe.description: Get a view of the data within a dataset.

items.description:
Ordered row values with length always equal to `num_rows` on the
 corresponding view.

google.protobuf.Value.description:
Ordered row values with length always equal to `num_rows` on the
 corresponding view.

additionalProperties.description:
Ordered row values with length always equal to `num_rows` on the
 corresponding view.

value.description:
Ordered row values with length always equal to `num_rows` on the
 corresponding view.

items.description:
Ordered row values with length always equal to `num_rows` on the
 corresponding view.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.ListDatasetsRequ.title: ListDatasetsRequestFilters

query.description: search query substring match for name and description

projectId.description: filter datasets associated with the project

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.ListDatasetsRequ.description: Filter listed datasets by ALL filters specified

totalCount.description:
Total count of datasets which can be listed with applicable
 filters, regardless of page size

name.description:
New dataset name. If not provided, will use the name of the dataset being
 cloned

description.description:
Human-readable description of the dataset.
 If not provided, will use the name of the dataset being cloned

projectId.description: The project to add the new dataset to

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.EvaluateResponse.title: EvaluateResponse
lmai.proto.webserver.v2.EvaluateResponse.description:
The index of the float value corresponds to that of
 the string combination sent in the request.
 Ex: scores.values[i] is taken from
 input[i], ground_truth[i], context[i], output[i] in EvaluateRequest

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.EvaluateDatasetR.title: EvaluateDatasetResponse
lmai.proto.webserver.v2.EvaluateDatasetR.description: models and scores correspond in the same manner as in EvaluateResponse

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetMetricRequest.title: GetMetricRequest
lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetMetricRequest.description: Requested metric must have at least id or name set.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetMetricRespons.title: GetMetricResponse
lmai.proto.webserver.v2.GetMetricRespons.description: Returns a full metric object with all fields set.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateFineTuneJo.title: CreateFineTuneJobRequest

fineTuneJobConfig.description: Partial configuration with parameters for the fine-tune job.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateFineTuneJo.description:
Create a new Fine Tune Job
 Initialized with the provided configuration parameters.

baselineModelId.description: The ID for the model used as the starting point for training.

trainDatasetId.description:
The dataset to use for training, with splits baked in or to be
 derived dynamically

testDatasetId.description: The dataset to use for an unbiased evaluation of the model

items.description:
Set of columns to be used in fine-tuning.
 Supported columns: input, output, ground_truth
 For example, a task similar to summarization might need output and
 ground_truth.

id.description: The ID of the fine tune job.

name.description: Name corresponding to the fine tuned model derived from this job

trainedModelFile.description: The trained model, if it was created successfully.

resultUrl.description: Url to view the full results and progress (e.g. external W&B url)

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ModelFil.title: ModelFile
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ModelFil.description: Actual file asset corresponding to a model

query.description: search query substring match for name and description

totalCount.description:
Total count of fine tune jobs which can be listed with applicable
 filters, regardless of page size

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.MetricBa.title: MetricBaseModel
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.MetricBa.description: Information about a base model corresponding to a metric

name.description: Human-readable name for the project, if one exists.

description.description: Human-readable description of the project, if one exists.

organizationId.description: Organization to associate the project with, if applicable

query.description: search query substring match for name and description

organizationId.description: search only projects associated with specific organization

totalCount.description:
Total count of projects which can be listed with applicable
 filters, regardless of page size

pseudoLabelJobConfig.description: Partial configuration containing updates via its non-null fields.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.PseudoLabelJobCo.title: PseudoLabelJobConfig

datasetId.description: ID of the main dataset to be pseudo-labeled

fewShotDatasetId.description: ID of the dataset containing few-shot examples. Optional.

activeLabeledDatasetId.description:
ID of the actively labeled dataset. Optional. If null, this job is for
 active learning.

items.description:
Subset of columns to be used in pseudo-labeling.
 Expected columns: input, output, ground_truth
 For example, a summarization task might not need an input column.
 By default, all columns are used.

baseEvaluationMetric.title: BaseEvaluationMetric
baseEvaluationMetric.description: Reserved field. Do not use  at the moment.

skipActiveLabeling.description:
If true, skip active labeling, which involves an intermediate Dataset
 created for human labeling.

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.PseudoLabelJobCo.description: Configuration for LLM Judge labeling job.

template.description: The template string that defines the prompt
